I've been using Revlon Colorstay for oily/combo skin for 12 years and was scared to try anything else because it was too perfect. The only thing was, lately I've been suspecting that it is not really non comedogenic (it doesn't promise that anyway) and is probably the only reason I still break out. (I noticed my skin gets bad any time I accidentally fall asleep in it.) So I decided to try to find a foundation that had all the same qualities (good natural color, stays on all day, stays matte, good coverage, not cakey) but won't clog my pores. This sounded like the closest thing. Even though it is triple the price, I figured it was worth it because since it has SPF 30, I could stop buying the expensive SPF 30 I usually put on under the Revlon since Revlon only contains an SPF 6. This foundation, besides promising to be non comedogenic, promises to stay put for 16 hours and stay matte. It did neither for me. I only tried it for two days because I wanted to be able to send it back if it wasn't working, but this is how it compared:
Color: I'm in between super light and tan and sometimes use self tanners. So in Revlon I either use Sand Beige by itself or mix Sand Beige with a lighter color called Buff. Either way looks really good/natural on me and just depends how tan or non tan my body is. So with this one that only comes in a few colors, I bought the nude to try and figured if I liked it I would buy the lighter color opal and mix them when I need it to be lighter. Well, I didn't get that far, but the nude was a little too orange. I asked a friend and she thought it looked fine but I thought it looked too orange/tan to me. I also think it looked different in different lighting so sometimes looked worse than others.

Applying: It definitely went on much lighter and thinner than Revlon Colorstay which was a plus and still covered everything: acne, scars, freckles, etc. And it dried very fast which I like. Sometimes the Revlon doesn't dry fast enough for me when I'm in a hurry to finish my routine. BUT even though it dried, it was shiny. When I powdered it, I may as well not have put any powder at all because it was still pretty shiny. Especially on my forehead and nose. But when I touched it, it was totally dry. So that was kind of weird. I never experienced anything like that before and that's not really a look I like. I've always liked matte looking skin but like my blush to be shimmery - only on my cheeks. When I powder the Revlon it becomes very matte.

Throughout the day: I normally have an oily t zone and with the Revlon Colorstay, the oily t zone starts to come out after 4-5 hours and the rest of my face stays normal. I usually use Clean and Clear oil blotters which would take care of it for another several hours and not take the make up off at all. With the Vichy, I felt like my entire face was getting very oily after only an hour. It's a little hard to tell since it was shiny from the beginning but I definitely could feel a difference too. When I used the oil blotters, the make up actually came off in some spots onto the sheet. So it does not stay put as promised. By the end of my 9 hour work day my jawline was missing and forehead was spotty. (And it's supposed to last 16 hours.) That never happens with the Revlon Colorstay. The second day I tried powdering instead of oil blotting and it was still very spotty, maybe even worse.

The first day I put it on with nothing underneath. The second day I used a semi expensive mattifying primer on one side of my face and what I consider my very expensive mattifying sunscreen that I normally use, on the other side of my face, to see if it made a difference but it did not. Still super shiny and oily and did not stay entirely on for my 9 hour work day. I was very disappointed because I did go in with high hopes and not wanting to be a skeptic, but I didn't see a reason to test it for a 3rd day. I can't say whether or not it prevented break outs since I didn't use it long enough. I don't want to continue using Revlon Colorstay if it's going to continue to clog my pores so I'll still be searching for something that has all these qualities I need and have to use it in the meantime. Very disappointed.

Update: I tried CoverGirl Ready Set Gorgeous foundation and so far I've been liking that one. It's oil free, non pore clogging. I've been using it for over a week and so far haven't had any new breakouts. I even slept in it once. Coverage is surprisingly pretty good, staying power is decent, comes in a wide variety of colors and was a lot more matte than Vichy. And best of all it was only $6.99 at Target. Revlon was still the best make up I've ever used in terms of staying power and staying matte but so far I like how the CoverGirl has many of the good qualities as well as not clogging my pores! And if you don't have acne, you don't need as much of it and won't end up going through the vicious cycle of pore clogging and covering! Highly recommend anyone who is acne prone & oily instead of Vichy.

But, the scent is strong and persistent, especially right after you sprays it. It goes away after some time but you still get a whiff of it once in awhile through out the day. Then, when you are just about to forget about it, you get another strong whiff while you are trying to wash your hair in the shower. And it's strong enough for me to cringe a bit.
It could be that my tolerance for fragrance has gone down considerable since I've started using products with less or no fragrance and stop using cologne since having babies in the house for past few years... but I have used other hairspray with some fragrance in them and it didn't cause me to such adverse reaction to it.

After reading review after review on Amazon I took the plunge and ordered the Babyliss.  I am an Amazon Prime member so I am always happy to find something that I want that will be at my door in 2 days -- this actually came in one.  (Though that isn't always good when I am trying to hide a purchase!) I couldn't wait to use this dryer so I washed and conditioned my hair the evening it arrived.

I will start off telling you the one reason I didn't give this 4 stars.  Others have mentioned the weight and I will agree that so far this is the heaviest dryer I have ever used.  I am getting better with it the more I use it and that is not enough of an issue that I still don't love it -- but I would imagine my Mom wouldn't like it since she has had carpel tunnel issues in the past.  I hit my head with this dryer the 1st time I used it because I wasn't used to the weight.  Though I am not known for my grace either.

I like to style my hair with only a hairdryer but since I had a mishap with some home hi-lighting, my hair is pretty damaged so it is too frizzy after blow drying because of its current condition that I have had to also use a big curling iron or flat iron to smooth it out.  No More.  I dry it all over which I swear now takes me about 3 minutes - this thing is strong - then I attached the nozzle to smooth and slightly curl my hair under.  Amazing.  My hair is smooth and shiny.  I honestly didn't believe that I would be able to style my hair so quickly and have it look so good.  The first time I used it I had so much volume that it was almost comical.  My hair was a bit too big.  I was used to styling my hair with a lesser dryer and I could tell after one use with this dryer.

A few mentioned the buttons.  I had no issues with them.  I always look at my dryer to see what the heat, speed etc is before using it so it didn't matter to me like others mentioned that you couldn't change your setting without looking.  It's something that doesn't slow me down or matter.  I used it only on high heat with both settings.  I use the lower speed with the nozzle for more precise styling and high heat, high speed for all over drying.  I have never been one to bother with the other settings.

The price for this hairdryer is great.  I've bought drug store hairdryers that cost $40 to $50 and there is no comparison.  I think it is even a little cheaper now than when I ordered it.  I'm tempted to order a backup.  That tells you how much I love this thing.

If weight isn't an issue - this is the dryer for you.

While this does brighten the under eye area, it did nothing to cover my under eye circles or reduce puffiness. I'm 55, with normal cool toned skin and purplish/gray circles under my eyes, so, as recommended on the Jane Iredale site, I chose shade  #3. I tried applying this concealer a couple of ways, starting with moisturizer and Lancome La Base. First I applied it under foundation in a triangular shape under my eyes, blending with a beauty blender. Circles were not covered, so I applied a bit more. The result was very bright highlights under my eyes, but still very obvious circles. I next tried applying the concealer over my foundation, same results. This stuff is not cheap and for the price I paid I expected better results. If you're looking for a concealer to cover slight discoloration or just want to brighten your under eye area, this may work for you, but if you're expecting this to be your HG concealer for under eye circles, keep looking.

I really wanted to like this, and my most counts I do. The ingredients are not nearly as scary as some face creams and It does a great job of moisturizing while not feeling greasy in the least. I didn't really notice any "correction" on my fine lines, but honestly I didn't expect to since I keep my face well moisturized and use other, similar products. Well that and the fact that I couldn't make myself keep using it beyond a short trial period. I would continue to use this, but as my review title indicated...the smell. For a product touting that it is 93% natural, you would think they would have toned down the perfume, but nope. this stuff smells so strongly that I could smell it on the washcloth when I washed my face that night. I'm pretty sensitive to strong perfumes; they're a major migraine trigger for me, so I'm calling it quits with this correcting cream. There are plenty of other products out there that don't make my face smell like the scent isle at the dollar store.
I will purchase the full size...it works just as great compare to higher end items.

My first introduction to Crabtree & Evelyn was in 2006, when I bought the old white colored metal tube of Rosewater that requires the key to empty the tube. I love this scent and have always used it sparingly, as a luxury item. My coworker "borrowed" it and used over half the tube this year, so I had to replenish my stock. I bought the new packaging tube, which makes the rose on the front look pixelated, and does not tell the story of the Rosewater fragrance. I dislike the cheap tube, and noticed the product is less solid than the old one I still have. It's not runny, but clearly the company is cutting corners on packaging and source materials. The lotion itself is still delightfully fragrant, smooth and goes on like silk.

When I opened the package I was so dubious I came to the site to verify the packaging looks like this on the site. It's still great, but I can tell the difference in the solidity of the cream; though the packaging is poor, it is what inside that counts.

I love the scent and will continue to buy it, but I feel embarrassed to display this cheap-looking tube at work, and would rather take the age-defying hand remedy in to work, since the packaging is less flimsy. I hope Crabtree and Evelyn will improve the packaging and keep up the quality of the product. I also wonder what chemicals are in the plastic tubing that are not in the metal tubes.

Reviewing a perfume is like reviewing a color: you either like it or you don't like it. You're wearing the perfume, so it's your own personal preference and/or the preference of someone you want to "impress." My wife wanted to try Calvin Klein Eternity. She's not much of a perfume wearer. Her favorite scent was always Chanel No. 5. That had a sweet, flowery, almost powdery scent. Eternity seems to be more fruity--something almost tart and fresh, like lemon or another citrus.

Again, you either like the scent or you don't. The bottle came in great condition and the spray worked fine. Try the scent and judge for yourself.

I have been using this product daily for about 5 months. It moisturizes nicely, without being oily by the end of the day & hasn't caused any acne outbreaks. I really like it. I have always been very careful not to touch the dropper as I dispensed into my palm. However, I recently left for a 10 day trip and I used the dropper to re-fill a small, travel-size pump I had. I probably went back and forth between the two containers at least 10 times to fill the smaller container. Although I was still careful with the dropper I must've allowed it to touch the other container at some point because I returned from my trip to find little white growths in the dropper of my Marula bottle and I can also see them on the interior floor of the bottle when I look through the bottom under a light. Needless to say, although I don't want to waste the other half of my 1.69 oz bottle I'm leery of putting that on my face! I've only used argan oil & Dr. Hauschka brand face oils before and I never had an issue with those growing anything or changing color, but those have also been pump dispensers & not droppers. Anyway, the point is do your best not to allow the dropper to touch ANYTHING as it seems the oil WILL allow stuff to grow in it if contaminated :-(

I have extremely hard water in my area and my hair looked HORRIBLE, my roots looked extremely greasy and flat, my blonde highlights in my hair turned an orange coppery color, and my hair was hard, dry, and look very damaged. For the price i'm happy and plan on continuing to alternate the product with my regular shampoo.
